ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned about documentary filmmaking: how to do it and its significance in history and literature.

I learned a lot about the theories behind documentary filmmaking. I appreciated the workshops to learn camera skills and editing skills. I learned about the process of producing a documentary from start to finish and was able to plan it out with the help of my professor and TF, Paloma Izquierda.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I love how much I learned about the history of documentary filmmaking through the interesting readings and documentaries. I wish we discussed them more and learned more applicable skills like filmmaking and storytelling techniques and got some time in class to practice them. I also wished the class was shorter. It was difficult to maintain focus and energy over four hours.

There could be more guidance around week to week assignments. They were mostly open-ended, and as an introductory class, it often left me confused on what the expectations were.  They could work more on teaching camera, lighting, and editing skills before we went out and created our own stuff because then we were getting critiqued about aspects that had never been learned. However, the instructor chose good guest speakers, weekly readings, and weekly films. The QCQs seemed to be more busy work as we often didnt get feedback. The class was a very open environment and collaborative with great feedback from peers and instructors on our screenings.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course to another student looking to learn about the field of documentary filmmaking in general, but it will be a lot of work by yourself if you want to improve technical skills in filmmaking or learn how to create a story.
